_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:34:29 using v2.5
title: What proportion of calls are resolved without a person needing to go to hospital?
analysis_commentary:
As the majority of people who call 999 are in an emergency situation which requires urgent support, the proportion of calls which were resolved with telephone advice only was low. From April 2011 to November 2013, this was roughly 5.0% of calls. However, from November 2013 onwards this has increased and was 9.9% in December 2014.

Roughly one third of calls to 999 were visited by an ambulance but the person didn't need to go to hospital. This has increased slightly over time and was 37.9% in December 2014.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
